abstract: Diane Wilsey, longtime chief executive of Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco, denies reports that she will step down, despite intense controversy over her leadership; state attorney general is investigating her payment of $457,000 of museum funds to husband of Fine Arts employee and four prominent board members have resigned in protest.

keywords.value: Fine Arts Museums of San Francisco
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: de Young, M H, Memorial Museum
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Diane Wilsey is facing challenges after 20 years as head of the board of the Fine Arts Museums.
snippet: Diane Wilsey is facing challenges after 20 years as head of the board of the Fine Arts Museums....

headline.main: For San Francisco’s Queen of Philanthropy, No Quiet Exits
headline.print_headline: Arts Executive at the Center of a Storm
